page.title: 03CLIMBING BLACK COMBE
page.content: THE MAIN FOOTPATH IS WIDE AND EASY TO FOLLOW RIGHT TO THE TRIANGULATION POINT ON THE SUMMIT. IT STARTS FROM WHICHAM CHURCH ON THE A595 JUST TO THE EAST OF SILECROFT. THERE IS CAR PARK BY THE CHURCH AND A LANE LEADS UP TO THE START OF THE PATH. THE FIRST SECTION IS QUITE STEEP UP TO THE 900 FOOT CONTOUR WHEN IT EASES SLIGHTLY FOR THE REST OF THE TWO AND A HALF MILE TRIP TO THE TOP. THE VIEW FROM THE SUMMIT PLATEAU IS EXTENSIVE AND UNOBSTRUCTED IN ALL DIRECTIONS. IT PROVIDES A SUBSTANTIAL VIEW NORTHWARDS TO THE SCAFELL RANGE AND EASTWARD TO THE CONISTON FELLS. ON A CLEAR DAY THE ISLE OF MAN, THE PENNINES AND BLACKPOOL ARE VISIBLE, AND IN EXCEPTIONAL CIRCUMSTANCES BOTH SCOTTISH AND WELSH HILLS HAVE BEEN CLEARLY IDENTIFIED.
